insights.populationGrowth: Thimphu experiences rapid urbanization with 3.2% annual growth, driven by rural-urban migration and economic opportunities.
insights.educationLevel: Higher education levels with 78% literacy rate, home to major educational institutions including Royal University of Bhutan.
insights.employmentPattern: Government sector employs 35% of workforce, followed by services (28%) and private sector (25%). Youth unemployment remains a concern at 12%.
insights.housingPattern: Traditional architecture mandated by law, with modern amenities. Housing shortage drives rent inflation, affecting lower-income groups.

insights.temperature: Temperate climate with average annual temperature of 15.6°C. Summers reach 24°C while winters drop to 2°C. Located at 2,320m elevation providing cooler climate compared to plains.
insights.precipitation: Annual precipitation averages 650mm, with 78% occurring during monsoon (June-September). Dry winter season creates water scarcity challenges for urban areas.
insights.seasonality: Four distinct seasons: spring (March-May) with moderate temperatures, monsoon summer (June-September) with heavy rainfall, autumn (October-November) with clear skies, and dry winter (December-February) with occasional snowfall.
insights.extremeEvents: Increasing frequency of flash floods during monsoon affecting Wang Chhu river basin. Urban heat island effect emerging due to concrete construction and vehicle emissions.
